alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Northern Livingston; St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:09PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern St. Helena, north central Livingston, southeastern East Feliciana and northeastern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 445 PM CDT... At 408 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Darlington, or 10 miles southeast of Clinton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montpelier. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Northern Livingston; St. Helena
